alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 12:27PM CDT until June 14 at 12:45PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM EDT/1245 PM CDT/ FOR NORTHERN HENRY AND NORTHWESTERN CLAY COUNTIES... At 127 PM EDT/1227 PM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located over Abbeville, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Days Crossroads, Shorterville, Walter F. George Lock And Dam, Walter F George Lake, Standleys Store, Otho, Scottsboro Crossroads, Double Bridges, Pecan, Murphy Station, Graball, Screamer, Coates, Thomas Mill Creek, Lawrenceville, Bethel, Abbeville Municipal A/P and Willis Crossroads. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT/600 PM CDT/ for southeastern Alabama...and southwestern Georgia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This storm may cause serious injury and significant property damage.
